Apple Pie

pie
dessert

Ingredients

Crust

  • 3 cups flour
  • 1/4 cup butter (chilled)
  • 3/4 cup shortening (chilled)
  • 1 tbsp white sugar
  • 1 tsp kosher salt
  • 1/2 cup + 2-4 tbsp hard cider (or water)

Filling

  • 6 apples (some mix of honeycrisp, cosmic crisp, granny smith)
  • 2 tsp salt (divided)
  • 1 tbsp lime juice (optional)
  • 1 tbsp hard cider (optional)
  • 3/4 tsp cinnamon
  • 1/2 tsp nutmeg
  • 1/4 tsp ground ginger
  • 1/4 cup flour
  • 1/2 cup white sugar (divided)
  • 1/4 cup brown sugar
  • 1 tbsp butter (optional)

Procedure

Prep the apples

  1. Peel and slice the apples
  2. Mix 1/4 cup white sugar w/ 1 tsp salt and combine with the apples
  3. Place apples in a collinder to "deflate" for at least an hour

Make the crust

  1. Add salt and sugar to flour and mix to combine
  2. Add butter and shortening to flour and rub/cut in the fat until the mixture becomes pebbly. Some pea sized chucks of fat should still remain.
  3. Add liquid to the mixture, starting with about a half a cup and adding a tablespoon at a time until a dough forms.
  4. Split the dough into two roughly equal balls and wrap in plastic wrap. Pop in the fridge for dough to hydrate

Make the filling

  1. In a small bowl whisk together the cinnamon, nutmeg, ground ginger, flour, brown sugar and remaining 1/4 cup white sugar
  2. Once apples have "deflated", transfer to a large bowl. Save the drained liquid
  3. Add the small bowl of spices to the apples and stir to combine

Assemble the pie

  1. Take one dough ball from the fridge and roll out to a couple inches in diameter larger than the pie dish
  2. Transfer the dough to the pie pan by rolling on to the rolling pin and unrolling over the dish
  3. Take care to lift and drop the pie dough into the corners of the pie pan (do not stretch the dough)
  4. Use a fork to dock the bottom crust (poke holes for air to escape)
  5. Add the apples to the pie pan (either dumping in chaotically or by methodically spiralling)
  6. To the drained apple liquid add the optional hard cider and/or lime juice and pour over the apples
  7. Add the optional butter on top the apples, cut into small chunks
  8. Take the remaining dough ball and roll to just larger than the pie dish
  9. Transfer on top of the filling again using the rolling pin
  10. Crimp edges of the crust, cut some pattern of vents into the top crust, and sprinkle with optional cinnamon-sugar

Baking the pie

  1. Preheat oven to 400
  2. Optionally include a pizza stone on the bottom rack of the oven
  3. Once oven and optional pizza stone have reached temp, place the pie dish (in a cookie sheet) on the pizza stone (or just the bottom rack of the oven if not using the stone)
  4. Cook for 20 minutes
  5. Reduce heat to 350 and move the pie to the middle rack of the oven. If using the pizza stone, it can be removed from the oven.
  6. Cook another 20-30 minutes until filling is bubbly and crust is nicely browned
  7. If the edges of the pie start to brown too quickly, tent with foil
